Title: Ministry of Justice accomplishes 1920 Transactions during the third week of August
PageContent: The number of accomplished transactions at the Ministry of Justice during the third week of August have reached (1920) transactions varied from real estate registration and authentication. In addition, the number of services provided and completed electronically at the external service centers of the Ministry of Justice on August 12-16, 2018.The real estate registration transactions provided to the public included a number of service of which (107) ownership transfer transactions, (85) real estate change transactions, (39) registration and seizure transactions, (37) revocation of registration and seizure transactions, (92) service-related transactions, (23) correction and modification transactions, which makes a total of (383) real estate registration transactions within a week. Whereas the authentication transactions included (1398) of different authentications transactions, (1) proof of date transaction, (82) attestation transactions, (56) power of attorney revocation transactions, which makes a total of (1537) authentication transactions within a week.Real estate registration transaction represented 20% of the total number of the transactions provided, while the authentication transactions represented 80%, this number includes the total number of transactions of real estate registration and authentication of which the investors, citizens, and residents are interested in directly. Additionally, companies of investment and transactions for individuals including transactions of sales and donations, agency services, attestations and the issuance of certificates of ownership and mortgages, and other services provided by the Ministry of Justice, including electronic services provided by "SAK" project, which most services have been provided through it, which contributed to the increase of the number of transactions and their completion electronically. Such services involved real estate registration related to sales transactions that require the submission of electronic applications between the two parties (the Seller and the Purchaser), the receipt of titles from external centers, submission of prompt ownership lists, real estate valuation and organizational modification services, through a comprehensive employer of the ministry's external services centers, in addition to providing mortgage services through banks' branches.The expansion of the real estate registration and authentication provided to the public reflects the State's continuous development of the real estate sectors, underscoring the resilience of the national economy and that it is not affected by any external challenges. The indicators also highlight its potentials that make it attractive to domestic as well as foreign investments.

Title: Resumption of Legal and Judicial Training Program
PageContent: Ministry of Justice's Legal and Judicial Studies Center resumed its Legal and Judicial Training Program which includes specialized mandatory supplementary training programs to be held from the beginning of September until the conclusion of the training program on December 2018. The supplementary training program includes programs and workshops of the 16th mandatory training Course for new jurists, of which about 78 trainees take advantage of. In addition to the organization of 77 specialized training courses include various legal paths and skills. It is expected that 363 trainees will take advantage of it during the year 2018.The training program resumed by launching works of the mandatory training course besides the organization of four specialized training course for several legal bodies in various State's governmental entities. Such courses cover negotiation skills, legal problems management, administrative and legal control, seizure report (a specialized course for the Ministry of Economy and Trade staff), as well as the legal drafting of legislation and regulations, and the formulation of legal memorandums.   The training courses will vary according to the requirements and needs of the concerned bodies and the objectives of the training program. Twenty-one (21) training courses will be held in September on various legal issues aiming to develop the skills and experiences of the trainees in several legal disciplines. Such courses cover negotiation skills, legal problems management and legal protection of the State's public and private property. It also covers the legal drafting of legislation and regulations, implementation problems and the writ of execution, the practical and legal problems of cybercrimes. They also address the legal regulation of foreign institutions and trade representative offices, the legal confrontation of administrative and financial corruption, the ethics of practicing legal professions, skills of interpreting and analyzing legal texts, the legal organization of information technology, strategic planning in the legal field. They involve courses on real estate brokerage, real estate valuation, the legal provisions of the experts in Qatari Law, the mechanisms of consumer protection in Qatari Law, in addition to law enforcement in Cybercrimes. The courses also include a course on preparing legal instructors to prepare qualified legal instructor in the Qatari training sector, a course on stadium riots (challenges of 2020), a course on the general principles of international commercial arbitration, rental disputes, and a course on the legal organization of the media. The training program includes 23 training courses in October, 28 training courses in November and 5 specialized training courses in December.On this occasion, Ms. Fatimah Belal, Director of Legal and Judicial Studies Center, said that the aim of the legal and judicial training program initiated by the Ministry of Justice under the supervision of His Excellency Dr. Hassan Bin Lahdan Al-Hasaan Al-Mohannadi, Minister of Justice and Acting Minister of State for Cabinet Affairs since the beginning of this year. The aim of the supplementary program is to develop the abilities and skills of Qatari jurists and to provide the highest standards of legal and judicial training to meet the State's legal and judicial needs. Adding that the Center uses the latest technologies and scientific programs through scientific training courses and advanced scientific research dealing with the most important legal issues, to serve the community and to build a distinguished legal generation in Qatar able to cope with the revival of the comprehensive modernization of our beloved State. Such programs are prepared by coordination and cooperation with the best academic, scientific and training institutions within and outside the State, which will contribute to instill the values of justice and respect of law in the coming generations, and to increase the legal awareness and spread the legal culture within the framework of our valuable heritage and our Arabic and Islamic traditions.  Within this vision, Ms. Fatimah Belal, indicated that, according to the instructions of His Excellency Minister, the Legal and Judicial Studies Center is keen to provide the appropriate environment for the trainees, trainers, and staff of the Center, in order to graduate  Qatari legal cadres qualified in the scientific and training fields within the framework of an integrated system that combines legal skills, knowledge experiences as well as humanitarian experiences that promote belonging to the homeland, develop respect for the values of civilization, the principles of coexistence and the rights of everyone to live in security and mutual respect.On her part, Ms. Nada Jassim Al-Abd Al-Jabbar, assistant director of the Legal and Judicial Studies Center for Training, explained that the resumption of the training courses in the Ministry comes within the framework of completing the training program for the year 2018. The evaluation of the training manual available on the Ministry of Justice website includes a comprehensive presentation for the contents of the mandatory and specialized courses, and the general and detailed objectives of each course to achieve the goals for which this manual was drafted, in particular with regard to the provision of the members with legal skills, such as legal writing, legal analysis, legal conversational, experiences and trends that enable a legal person to engage in any business with the aim of increasing his or her productivity and the transfer of new knowledge, skills and behavior to improve the efficiency of the jurists to perform any specific tasks at their work.Ms. Nada added that it's out of this vision the training team at the center strive hard to achieve the training objectives and requirements for all the governmental and non- governmental entities, to reach an outstanding training outcomes through the introduction of many topics that cope with the legal professions and modern legislation launched by the State in its legislative package for the year 2018, in a manner which took into account the main axes of each training program and identify the target groups for each program. The training team also works to achieve the Minister's directives to keep pace with the modern training methods in training through cooperation with many international expertise houses in this field. Pointing out that the training manual shows that the plan contained a lot of specialized programs that meet the diverse aspirations of the members of all legal disciplines in the country.
